text: <extra_id_0> Thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation of the T leukemic cell line Jurkat induced a transient increase in [ Ca2+ ] i . Proteolytic activity of the enzyme was required for this effect since diisopropyl fluorophosphate - <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> failed to increase [ Ca2+ ] i . Furthermore , hirudin and anti - <extra_id_0> thrombin III <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited the <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced [ Ca2+ ] i rise in Jurkat T cells .

A synthetic thrombin receptor agonist peptide ( TRP ) of 7 residues ( SFLLRNP ) was found to be as effective as <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for [ Ca2+ ] i mobilization , and both agonists induced Ca2+ release exclusively from internal stores .
<extra_id_0> Thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulated tyrosine phosphorylation of several proteins of molecular mass 40 , 42 , 70 , 120 , and 130 kDa .
There was a good correlation between <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced tyrosine phosphorylation of the latter three proteins and Ca2+ mobilization .
<extra_id_0> Thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and TRP also caused translocation of protein kinase C from the cytosol to the plasma membrane .
As a likely consequence of these events , <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activated the nuclear factor NF-kB .

Several cell lines of hematopoietic origin including the leukemic T cell line HPB.ALL and the erythroleukemic cell line K562 were responsive to <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , whereas others such as THP1 , a myelomonocytic cell line , and BL2 , a Burkitt lymphoma were refractory to <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or TRP stimulation .

The magnitude of the <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> response in the different cell types paralleled the expression of the <extra_id_0> thrombin receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .

We found that activation of Jurkat T cells by a combination of <extra_id_0> phytohemagglutinin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate led to a dramatic inhibition of <extra_id_0> thrombin receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression and to a concomitant loss of the <extra_id_0> thrombin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> response .
